thread.title: Biden's indecision fuels doubts he could still run in 2016
thread.title_full: Biden's indecision fuels doubts he could still run in 2016

author: JOSH LEDERMAN and JULIE PACE Associated Press
title: Biden's indecision fuels doubts he could still run in 2016
text:
Biden's indecision fuels doubts he could still run in 2016 By JOSH LEDERMAN and JULIE PACE Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story WASHINGTON 
Vice President Joe Biden's summer of uncertainty is turning into a fall of indecision, raising doubts about whether he could still be a serious presidential candidate in 2016. 
The latest sign of wavering came Thursday as several people close to Biden said his decision will likely drag on until later in October, making it unlikely he'll be on stage for the first Democratic debate Oct. 13. 
Yet the flood of activity to prepare for a potential run has sent mixed signals. 
Biden's team of political advisers has been quietly reaching out to Democrats who could join the campaign in senior roles, including State Department official Marie Harf and former Obama campaign official Paul Tewes. That's according to individuals familiar with the planning who requested anonymity to discuss private conversations. Related content
